comments.body: I like this idea but the diamonds should be real and all the blocks around it should be filled with tones of silverfish. Breaking the diamonds triggers this trap. Thus if you actually defeat the large number of creepy crawlies you get a good reward. Additionally, if you see high amounts of silverfish in an area you might get the idea to check it out as there might be a good reward on the other side.

Maybe these caves have more ores in general, more frequent and more exposed. Also I like the idea of making so silverfish are triggered by mining ores and not just from hurting other silverfish.

Also this will make silverfish a more common enemy than just in strongholds and mountains which is a nice thing
It's an interesting idea, but the Warden still shouldn't drop anything new, unique, or interesting as that would be an incentive to kill the Warden
It could just be another music disc in chests in the Deep Dark biome
Well mojang doesn’t want the warden to drop anything so maybe it could be found in one of the treasure rooms I like the idea though don’t get me wrong I’m just saying
There will be a sculk music disc added in 1.19 called "9" so maybe it could drop that
That does sound cool
The Warden should not drop anything, or anything useful at the very least. Having it drop something (useful) would make it a target for players
This would not necessarily be a useful feature! Possibly it could stop skulk sensors from sensing you though!
I think it would be a good thing if it dropped something good, then people WOULD try and kill it. But it would have to be extremely hard, making people choose sneaking around.

I think if the warden simply inflicted an effect preventing the player from placing and breaking blocks quickly I have a post about it here https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360074983371-the-warden-scream

I thnk its fine if the Warden breaks block if its just in the Deep Caves and in his direct vicinity while chasing the player. unlike the creeper its not a radius and they dont spawn outside the deep caves or explode out of nowhere, they would just attack the block between them and the player one at a time
Really, you should just try to avoid the Warden, but if you're bad at that, I think this would be a good solution
I wouldn't do a hand clap, maybe an uber-powerful heartbeat

A ranged attack would work. I'd add that maybe if the player has aggravated a warden, and gets out of range, the warden can reappear out of nearby skulk blocks. There are alternatives to a ranged attack too- such as mining fatigue. (Or how about this: If the Warden is near the player but cannot reach them, it can create 'Skulk Vines' that travel through blocks, and deal damage/ensnare the player on contact- effectively preventing pillaring and tunneling.)

The Warden shouldn't be unbeatable- you should be able to defeat it, or at least escape. But it shouldn't have an especially easy solution.
What if it climbed up or dug down to reach you
you can be a two colored werewolf
you should find them in thick forest
you should find them in thick forest
This seems awesome maybe you can combine this with my idea ( amethyst ball )

I love this bcuz snowballs do tend to be dust collectors. Crouching to place a layer & Standing to throw.

Alternatively, if you don't want to change the original snowballs, you could make a ❄ Powdered Snowball❄ that is thrown or dispensed and freezes on impact, then placeable & stackable (while crouching and right clicking/trigger) as an actual stack of snowballs. Grabbing them off the stack while crouching and left clicking/trigger. It would make extremely immersive snowballs fights!!!
It could also function as a buff to snow golems since they could then apply the freezing affect and damage mobs.
I like your idea of a windy cave biome. Maybe it could spawn near mountains.
Good idea, but why would there be wind under ground?

I was trying to think of a connection to beds since they also explode, and it got me thinking that candles could be related to setting your spawn point. When you die they would have to be relit. This may have to be used in conjunction with Respawn Anchors
I'm aware that the devs are aiming for this mob to be avoidable but that doesn't mean it can't drop something useful.
It could drop its heart and every time you right clicked it, it could beat and send off a vibration to other sculk sensors.
Or it could drop something that has the properties of an already existing item like a redstone repeater, making it useful but not unique.
It does mean it shouldn't drop anything useful. Having any sort of useful item will automatically make it a target for that item, especially if it is a new, powerful, and/or unique item.

btw they don't want the warden to be somthing to kill they want it to be somthing to aviod but if you want to kill the warden it will drop the trophy like the dragon egg but don't worry the warden may not drop somthing useful but there may be a strucure that will have good loot just like in the end thedragon is not what your looking for its the end ship and shulkers

The developers already said, that they don't exactly plan to add a warden drop. If they decide to do it anyways, it won't have any use. It will just be a trophy for killing the warden. That's what they said.

@cranzag That's why I'm saying that it should drop something that has the same features as something else like the properties of a lever. That wouldn't make it unique therefore not encouraging the player to kill the mob.
Mojang has clearly said, “no drops from the warden”
cool idea!

For the drop issue, maybe have some separate physical core/heart block linked to each Warden that the player has to sneak around to find which kills the warden upon it's destruction and drops as the reward for being sneaky and tactical as the devs intended. If so, the Warden itself can be made to just go dormant after taking too much damage, doing the Soul Burst before going down then waking up after a set "recharge" duration.
Sounds great! As a non-builder I spend most of my time yearning for more uses of copper

Yes! It could be a type of tree fern that grows over time like bamboo. Tree ferns are truly ancient. It would grow from spores, then, or saplings. Otherwise, it could be a date palm like the one they revived a few years back, and it could yield dates.

As an extra challenge, reviving the ancient plant might require a certain splash potion or combination of potion and item, like a splash water bottle, healing potion, and bone meal.
I was just about to post a topic about this, it's a really good idea and would make people want to dig for stuff. Something I want out of this is new wood types from prehistoric trees.

Just my opinion

I think that instead of adding an entirely new item for just the sole purpose of de-oxidizing Copper, Glow Berries should be used instead. Glow Berries are fictional and berries are really varied (Bananas are scientifically classified as berries), so they can as well be considered somewhat acidic. Using a Glow Berry directly on a Copper block should have a unique squeezing sound and should also remove any wax, causing a Waxed Oxidized Copper Block to turn into a Weathered Copper Block, and so on. This would give Glow Berries a unique purpose and actually encourage people to search for them and farm them.
Ah nice.

Ok I dont know why this doesnt already have WAY more votes. This seems like a way the spyglass could actually be usefull... It's like a no-brianer to me to be able to use the spyglass for ranged weapons. I really hope this gets more votes, I was going to suggest this then I found your suggestion. I havent played the beta yet so i dont know exactly how the spyglass works but maybe when you hold the spyglass in your offhand and aim a crossbow or bow your spyglass would automatically engage zooming in and allowing better aim. Of cource when the spyglass is removed from offhand no zoom effect when aiming as usuall.
yes this is a good idea the only problem is that the aiming symbol wouldn’t be in the right position you would miss half the shots.
And the mushrooms should glow
Fire light sources actually do blink irl. Though I do agree with the smoke. No smoke when lit, but should emit smoke for about 120 seconds or more when the flame is put out.
oh, I just made a mirror of your post (we used very different keywords)
Standing by warmth or heat could protect you from the cold for a time. There could be a meter

I think additional things that would make this effect more realistic is if in cold biomes and snowstorms you also get this cold effect. This would be weaker in just a cold biome, slightly stronger during snowfall and super strong if in powdered snow. It would also be nice if a campfire could get rid of this effect in a small area around it. Also, it would be interesting if a hot effect were applied if you use this armor in the nether or other hot biomes.

Regarding cranzag's comment, this counter could be your heart's slowly going blue from right to left. The damage would start when it reaches the last red heart to the left. this would make sense as a player already having damage would succumb to hypothermia quicker. Additionally, as the blue hearts collect a slight slowing effect like when hungry would be a good indicator you are freezing over.
